tasks.task: Feed harvested forage to livestock during winter.
subtasks: Determine when to increase fed energy based on temperature and windchill.
Provide additional hay as a source of energy.
Harvest alfalfa, oats, and grass during summer and fall.
Store harvested forages in bales for winter feeding.
Check if temperatures fall below the tolerable range (20-32°F).
Assess windchill and adjust energy requirements accordingly.
Provide shelter or additional feed as needed.
Plan ahead for potential deep snow conditions requiring hay feeding.
Supplement rangeland grasses with stored forages.
